Events.html: 43 BC – Marcus Tullius Cicero is assassinated.
Events.text: Marcus Tullius Cicero is assassinated.

Events.html: 574 – Emperor Justin II retires due to recurring seizures of insanity. He abdicates the throne in favor of his general Tiberius, proclaiming him Caesar.
Events.text: Emperor Justin II retires due to recurring seizures of insanity. He abdicates the throne in favor of his general Tiberius, proclaiming him Caesar.

Events.html: 1703 – The Great Storm of 1703, the greatest windstorm ever recorded in the southern part of Great Britain, makes landfall. Winds gust up to 120 mph, and 9,000 people die.
Events.text: The Great Storm of 1703, the greatest windstorm ever recorded in the southern part of Great Britain, makes landfall. Winds gust up to 120 mph, and 9,000 people die.

Events.html: 1724 – Tumult of Thorn: Religious unrest is followed by the execution of nine Protestant citizens and the mayor of Thorn (Toruń) by Polish authorities.
Events.text: Tumult of Thorn: Religious unrest is followed by the execution of nine Protestant citizens and the mayor of Thorn (Toruń) by Polish authorities.

Events.html: 1732 – The Royal Opera House opens at Covent Garden, London, England.
Events.text: The Royal Opera House opens at Covent Garden, London, England.

Events.html: 1776 – Gilbert du Motier, Marquis de Lafayette, arranges to enter the American military as a major general.
Events.text: Gilbert du Motier, Marquis de Lafayette, arranges to enter the American military as a major general.

links.subject: Gilbert du Motier, Marquis de Lafayette
links.title: Gilbert du Motier, Marquis de Lafayette

Events.html: 1787 – Delaware becomes the first state to ratify the United States Constitution.
Events.text: Delaware becomes the first state to ratify the United States Constitution.

Events.html: 1862 – American Civil War: Battle of Prairie Grove, Arkansas.
Events.text: American Civil War: Battle of Prairie Grove, Arkansas.

Events.html: 1869 – American outlaw Jesse James commits his first confirmed bank robbery in Gallatin, Missouri.
Events.text: American outlaw Jesse James commits his first confirmed bank robbery in Gallatin, Missouri.

Events.html: 1917 – World War I: The United States declares war on Austria-Hungary.
Events.text: World War I: The United States declares war on Austria-Hungary.

Events.html: 1930 – W1XAV in Boston, Massachusetts telecasts video from the CBS radio orchestra program, The Fox Trappers. The telecast also includes the first television commercial in the United States, an advertisement for I.J. Fox Furriers, who sponsored the radio show.
Events.text: W1XAV in Boston, Massachusetts telecasts video from the CBS radio orchestra program, The Fox Trappers. The telecast also includes the first television commercial in the United States, an advertisement for I.J. Fox Furriers, who sponsored the radio show.

Events.html: 1936 – Australian cricketer Jack Fingleton becomes the first player to score centuries in four consecutive Test innings.
Events.text: Australian cricketer Jack Fingleton becomes the first player to score centuries in four consecutive Test innings.

Events.html: 1941 – World War II: Attack on Pearl Harbor – The Imperial Japanese Navy carries out a surprise attack on the United States Pacific Fleet and its defending Army and Marine air forces at Pearl Harbor, Hawaii. (For Japan's near-simultaneous attacks on Eastern Hemisphere targets, see December 8.)
Events.text: World War II: Attack on Pearl Harbor – The Imperial Japanese Navy carries out a surprise attack on the United States Pacific Fleet and its defending Army and Marine air forces at Pearl Harbor, Hawaii. (For Japan's near-simultaneous attacks on Eastern Hemisphere targets, see December 8.)

Events.html: 1946 – A fire at the Winecoff Hotel in Atlanta, Georgia, kills 119 people, the deadliest hotel fire in U.S. history.
Events.text: A fire at the Winecoff Hotel in Atlanta, Georgia, kills 119 people, the deadliest hotel fire in U.S. history.

links.subject: A fire at the Winecoff Hotel
links.title: Winecoff Hotel fire

Events.html: 1949 – Chinese Civil War: The government of the Republic of China moves from Nanking to Taipei, Taiwan.
Events.text: Chinese Civil War: The government of the Republic of China moves from Nanking to Taipei, Taiwan.

Events.html: 1962 – Prince Rainier III of Monaco revises the principality's constitution, devolving some of his power to advisory and legislative councils.
Events.text: Prince Rainier III of Monaco revises the principality's constitution, devolving some of his power to advisory and legislative councils.

Events.html: 1963 – Instant replay makes its debut during an American Army–Navy football game.
Events.text: Instant replay makes its debut during an American Army–Navy football game.

Events.html: 1965 – Pope Paul VI and Patriarch Athenagoras I simultaneously revoke mutual excommunications that had been in place since 1054.
Events.text: Pope Paul VI and Patriarch Athenagoras I simultaneously revoke mutual excommunications that had been in place since 1054.

Events.html: 1971 – Pakistan President Yahya Khan announces the formation of a coalition government with Nurul Amin as Prime Minister and Zulfikar Ali Bhutto as Deputy Prime Minister.
Events.text: Pakistan President Yahya Khan announces the formation of a coalition government with Nurul Amin as Prime Minister and Zulfikar Ali Bhutto as Deputy Prime Minister.

Events.html: 1972 – Imelda Marcos survives an assassination attempt using a bolo knife against her.
Events.text: Imelda Marcos survives an assassination attempt using a bolo knife against her.

Events.html: 1972 – Apollo 17, the last Apollo moon mission, is launched. The crew takes the photograph known as The Blue Marble as they leave the Earth.
Events.text: Apollo 17, the last Apollo moon mission, is launched. The crew takes the photograph known as The Blue Marble as they leave the Earth.

Events.html: 1975 – Warschauer Kniefall - German Chancellor Willy Brandt makes a gesture of humility towards the victims of the Warsaw Ghetto Uprising.
Events.text: Warschauer Kniefall - German Chancellor Willy Brandt makes a gesture of humility towards the victims of the Warsaw Ghetto Uprising.

Events.html: 1975 – Indonesian invasion of East Timor: The invasion begins.
Events.text: Indonesian invasion of East Timor: The invasion begins.

Events.html: 1982 – In Texas, Charles Brooks, Jr., becomes the first person to be executed by lethal injection in the United States.
Events.text: In Texas, Charles Brooks, Jr., becomes the first person to be executed by lethal injection in the United States.

Events.html: 1983 – An Iberia Airlines Boeing 727 collides with an Aviaco DC-9 in dense fog while the two airliners are taxiing down the runway at Madrid–Barajas Airport, killing 93 people.
Events.text: An Iberia Airlines Boeing 727 collides with an Aviaco DC-9 in dense fog while the two airliners are taxiing down the runway at Madrid–Barajas Airport, killing 93 people.

Events.html: 1987 – Pacific Southwest Airlines Flight 1771 crashes near Paso Robles, California, killing all 43 on board, after a disgruntled passenger shoots his ex-boss traveling on the flight, then shoots both pilots and himself.
Events.text: Pacific Southwest Airlines Flight 1771 crashes near Paso Robles, California, killing all 43 on board, after a disgruntled passenger shoots his ex-boss traveling on the flight, then shoots both pilots and himself.

Events.html: 1988 – Spitak Earthquake: In Armenia an earthquake measuring 6.9 on the Richter scale kills more than 25,000, injures 30,000 and leaves 500,000 homeless out of a population of 3,500,000.
Events.text: Spitak Earthquake: In Armenia an earthquake measuring 6.9 on the Richter scale kills more than 25,000, injures 30,000 and leaves 500,000 homeless out of a population of 3,500,000.

Events.html: 1988 – Yasser Arafat recognizes the right of Israel to exist.
Events.text: Yasser Arafat recognizes the right of Israel to exist.

Events.html: 1993 – The Long Island Rail Road massacre: Passenger Colin Ferguson murders six people and injures 19 others on the LIRR in Nassau County, New York.
Events.text: The Long Island Rail Road massacre: Passenger Colin Ferguson murders six people and injures 19 others on the LIRR in Nassau County, New York.

Events.html: 1995 – The Galileo spacecraft arrives at Jupiter, a little more than six years after it was launched by Space Shuttle Atlantis during Mission STS-34.
Events.text: The Galileo spacecraft arrives at Jupiter, a little more than six years after it was launched by Space Shuttle Atlantis during Mission STS-34.

Events.html: 1999 – A&M Records, Inc. v. Napster, Inc.: The Recording Industry Association of America sues the peer-to-peer file-sharing service Napster, alleging copyright infringement.
Events.text: A&M Records, Inc. v. Napster, Inc.: The Recording Industry Association of America sues the peer-to-peer file-sharing service Napster, alleging copyright infringement.

links.subject: A&M Records, Inc. v. Napster, Inc.
links.title: A&M Records, Inc. v. Napster, Inc., 114 F.Supp.2d 896

Events.html: 2003 – The Conservative Party of Canada is officially registered, following the merger of the Canadian Alliance and the Progressive Conservative Party of Canada.
Events.text: The Conservative Party of Canada is officially registered, following the merger of the Canadian Alliance and the Progressive Conservative Party of Canada.

Events.html: 2005 – Rigoberto Alpizar, a passenger on American Airlines Flight 924 who allegedly claimed to have a bomb, is shot and killed by a team of U.S. federal air marshals at Miami International Airport.
Events.text: Rigoberto Alpizar, a passenger on American Airlines Flight 924 who allegedly claimed to have a bomb, is shot and killed by a team of U.S. federal air marshals at Miami International Airport.

Events.html: 2005 – Ante Gotovina, a Croatian army general accused of war crimes but later acquitted, is captured in the Playa de las Américas, Tenerife, by Spanish police.
Events.text: Ante Gotovina, a Croatian army general accused of war crimes but later acquitted, is captured in the Playa de las Américas, Tenerife, by Spanish police.

Events.html: 2006 – A tornado strikes Kensal Green, North West London, seriously damaging about 150 properties.
Events.text: A tornado strikes Kensal Green, North West London, seriously damaging about 150 properties.

Events.html: 2007 – The Hebei Spirit oil spill begins in South Korea after a crane barge that had broken free from a tug collides with the Very Large Crude Carrier, Hebei Spirit.
Events.text: The Hebei Spirit oil spill begins in South Korea after a crane barge that had broken free from a tug collides with the Very Large Crude Carrier, Hebei Spirit.
